alert.note: Alert for Fremont; Johnson; Natrona; Washakie (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 04 at 8:34PM MDT until September 04 at 10:45PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Riverton has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Fremont County in central Wyoming... Northwestern Natrona County in central Wyoming... Southeastern Washakie County in central Wyoming... Southwestern Johnson County in north central Wyoming... * Until 1045 PM MDT. * At 834 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain falling across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mayoworth, Barnum and Arminto. This includes the following streams and drainages... Peterson Draw, Hackett Creek, Sheep Creek, Willow Creek, Box Elder Creek, North Fork Buffalo Creek, Trout Creek, Hibbard Draw, Little Eagle Creek, First Water Creek, Shaw Creek, Posey Creek, Little Deep Creek, Rock Creek, South Fork Little Canyon Creek, North Fork Little Canyon Creek, Baker Creek, Dry Fork Otter Creek, Snyder Creek, North Poker Creek, Red Fork Powder River, Alkali Creek, Lone Tree Creek, Indian Creek, Lost Creek, Pine Creek, South Willow Creek, Three Buttes Creek, Cherry Hill Creek Draw, North Fork Pass Creek, South Fork Badwater Creek, Buffalo Creek, Blue Creek, North Fork Little Cnayon Creek, Pass Creek, E-K Creek, Little Canyon Creek, South Fork Buffalo Creek, Cedar Gap Draw, Middle Fork Powder River, South Fork Sand Creek, Cherry Creek, Nowood River, North Fork Beaver Creek, Hole-in-the-Wall Draw, First Water Draw, North Fork Red Fork Powder River, Arch Creek, Gordon Creek, Beaver Creek, Bear Creek, Dry Creek, South Fork Otter Creek, Badwater Creek, North Fork Powder River, Split Rock Creek, Deep Creek, Sanchez Creek, Nowood Creek, Crawford Creek, Murphy Creek, Kuiper Draw, Spring Creek, Middle Fork Little Canyon Creek, Sand Creek, East Fork Buffalo Creek, South Fork Cottonwood Creek, Martin Pass Draw, Dry Fork Badwater Creek, North Fork Red Powder River, Cottonwood Creek, North Fork Otter Creek, Sawmill Creek, Dean Springs Draw, Bates Creek, Red Creek, Cave Gulch, Stove Creek, Beartrap Creek, Sioux Creek, Crooked Creek, Clear Creek, Jackpot Reservoir Draw, South Fork Eagle Creek and North Fork Cottonwood Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
